thread.title: Proxy firm ISS joins Glass Lewis to oppose Tesla's stock award to Musk

title: Proxy firm ISS joins Glass Lewis to oppose Tesla's stock award to Musk

organizations.name: international space station research and development conference

text: March 8, 2018 / 8:05 PM / Updated 26 minutes ago Proxy firm ISS joins Glass Lewis to oppose Tesla's stock award to Musk Reuters Staff 2 Min Read (Reuters) - Proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services said on Thursday Tesla Inc ( TSLA.O ) shareholders should vote against a proposal for a $2.6 billion performance-based stock option grant for Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk. FILE PHOTO: Elon Musk, founder, CEO and lead designer at SpaceX and co-founder of Tesla, speaks at the International Space Station Research and Development Conference in Washington, U.S., July 19, 2017. REUTERS/Aaron P. Bernstein Three days ago Glass Lewis said the same, claiming the proposed grant would dilute other investors and be too costly. “While we recognize that Musk’s leadership and his vision for Tesla in its mission to accelerate the world’s transition to sustainable energy make him a unique CEO in many ways, the grant would ... dwarf those of top executives at the largest and most profitable public companies,” ISS said. Tesla, which reported its worst ever loss in the fourth quarter, is under pressure as its much-anticipated Model 3 sedan has already missed several key production targets. Some analysts have questioned whether Musk’s other interests, from space exploration to tunnel boring technology, are a distraction at what is seen as a critical time for Tesla. Separately, Musk also took to Twitter on Thursday to call on U.S. President Donald Trump to challenge Chinese auto trade rules. (This story corrects proxy firm’s name to Institutional Shareholder Services in paragraph 1.) Reporting by Arjun Panchadar in Bengaluru; Editing by Shounak Dasgupta
